intro: Canthium gymnosporioides, commonly known as the African eggplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and the plant is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
